channel.title: I have a problem using new doors

item.title: I have a problem using new doors
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

[code] public void ReplaceObjectAll(int x, int y, int obj, int face) {
for (int i = 0; i < PlayerHandler.maxPlayers; i++) {
client c = (client) PlayerHandler.players[i];

		if (c == null || c.disconnected) {
			continue;
		}
		c.ReplaceObject(x, y, obj, face);
	}
}[/code]

Read full topic
item.source: I have a problem using new doors

item.title: I have a problem using new doors
item.dc:creator: @anti-dos anti-dos
item.description:
@anti-dos wrote:

I suggest you use a decent Door-handler, try looking in your “config” folder, look for doors.cfg open it and simpley add the door coords etc…
such as:

//     XCoord	YCoord	Id	FaceO	FaceC	Face	State	Height

item.title: I have a problem using new doors
item.dc:creator: @Oxygenn Oxygenn
item.description:
@Oxygenn wrote:

Well I used this:

if(objectX == #### && objectY == #### && objectID == ####)//closed door/gate { ReplaceObject(objectX,objectY,####, -1); }

But it only opens for that player.
(e.g: Player A opens door and walks though, Player B watches and it looks like Player A walked through a closed door.)

How do I make it so that when Player A opens the door, it opens for all players, not just the player that opened it.
Regards.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: April 27, 2009, 03:57:25 pm[/size][hr]New problem, I just made it so that they open. But like on a door that’s slanted, when you open it, it doesn’t work and I’m guessing because it is slanted.

Read full topic
item.source: I have a problem using new doors
